title: Define the Domain
text: A square root function is undefined when the expression under the square root is negative. So, let's start by setting the expression under the sqare root to greater than or equal to zero. Then we know every value that makes this true is the domain of the function.

title: Answer
text: The domain of the function is $$(-\infty,\frac{4}{3}]$$, with the square bracket around $$\frac{4}{3}$$ denoting the fact that $$\frac{4}{3}$$ is a valid solution.
